contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Vengeance}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1818}} |Ship name= USS ''Vengeance'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder= |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= |Ship acquired=by purchase, 1805 |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= Broken up, 1818 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[Brig]] |Ship displacement= |Ship length= |Ship beam= |Ship draft= |Ship propulsion= Sail |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship complement= |Ship armament=3 Ã— guns |Ship notes= }} |} The second '''USS ''Vengeance''''' was a [[brig]] in the [[United States Navy]] during the [[First Barbary War]]. ''Vengeance'' was purchased by the [[United States Navy]] at [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], in 1805 for use as a bomb [[ketch]] against the [[Barbary pirates]]. Commanded by Lieutenant [[William Lewis (US Navy)|William Lewis]], she left Boston for the [[Mediterranean]] on 19 June and was with Capt. [[John Rodgers (naval officer, War of 1812)|John Rodgers]]' squadron of 13 warships when it appeared off [[Tunis]] on 1 August. Impressed by the American show of force, the [[Bey of Tunis]] elected to accept American peace terms, and ''Vengeance'' did not see action. Her subsequent movements are unknown, but she was broken up at [[New York, New York|New York City]] in 1818. == References == {{DANFS}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vengeance}} [[Category:Brigs of the United States Navy]]
